Montu's assistant, perceived as a better PT teacher by Montu
Montu falls in love with Neelima and they grow close
Neelima spends more time with Inder Mohan, possibly due to his better PT skills
Montu's teacher-buddy
Montu quickly realizes that Inder Mohan is a much better PT teacher than him, and gets even more irked when Neelu starts spending more time with Inder Mohan.
Neelu comes to Montu's side and helps him coach his team.
Singh keeps Montu's brother, Bablu, pinned to the ground as a punishment for not paying attention. This leads to a fight between Montu and Singh, after which Montu quits his job at the school.
Montu challenges Inder Mohan with a three sport competition: basketball, a 400m relay race, and kabaddi.
Montu challenges Inder Mohan with a three sport competition: basketball, a 400m relay race, and kabaddi.
Whoever's team won the competition would stay as the PT teacher, while the other would have to leave.
Inder Mohan accepts the challenge.
Montu foolishly lets Singh choose his team first in an attempt to impress Neelu by showing her his humility, and it backfires on him when he is left with a significantly weaker team.

Then, Neelu helps Montu implement very unorthodox training regimes, such as running from guard dogs to increase speed, catching loose chickens to increase agility, and dribbling a basketball through a cow dung minefield to increase dribbling ability. Their efforts pay off.
The children's parents start to revolt, saying that the competition is dragging their children's focus away from studies.
Chhalaang is a film undergoing the production process.
Hansal Mehta is a filmmaker who announced and directed Chhalaang.
Rajkummar Rao is an actor playing a lead role in Chhalaang.
Nushrat Bharucha is an actress playing a lead role in Chhalaang.
Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub is an actor playing a supporting role in Chhalaang.
Chhalaang was initially titled Turram Khan before its release.
A kabaddi scene for Chhalaang was filmed at Mumbai's Film City.
Chhalaang was initially scheduled to be released on 31 January 2020.
The release date for Chhalaang was postponed to 13 March 2020.
The release date for Chhalaang was further scheduled to 12 June 2020.
The film was again postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Finally it was released on 13 November 2020 on Amazon Prime Video coinciding with Diwali.
The song 'Deedar De' is a recreation of 'Deedar De' from the film Dus by Vishal–Shekhar.
But the duo clarified that they did not recreate the song,
The film currently holds a 70% on Rotten Tomatoes.
